info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 8:41PM MDT until May 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND WEST CENTRAL BASIN AND RANGE DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND HIGH FIRE DANGER...
...RED FLAG WARNING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, WEST CENTRAL BASIN AND RANGE, SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS FOR TODAY AS EXPIRED...
This afternoon's red flag warning for the west central and central New Mexico has expired as winds will continue to taper off and humidity will continue to rise behind a Pacific front overnight. Another round of gusty west to northwest winds south of a trailing upper level disturbance will create critical fire weather conditions in south- central and southwestern areas again Monday afternoon. A stronger Pacific cold front will move through the area Monday and there is a low chance of gusty virga showers with its passage across northwest and central areas.
* AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) and West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) Monday afternoon from 12PM to 8PM MDT.
* 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph today then west to northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph on Monday.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent today and 10 to 15 percent Monday.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Basin and Range; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
